docs.title: City Data Model - Transport
docs.text:
A PublicTransportElement represents any element of a public transport system. It can be a part of another PublicTransportElement and can be decomposed into smaller PublicTransportElement.

This ontology consists of the following patterns:

  • Micromobility Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Pedestrian Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Public Transport System Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Rail Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Road Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Transport Alert Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Transport Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Travel Corridor Pattern (transportnetwork)

The ontology also contains the following classes that are not assigned to any pattern:

  • ITS Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Micromobility Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Pedestrian Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Public Transport System Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Rail Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Road Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Transport Alert Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Transport Network Pattern (transportnetwork)
  • Travel Corridor Pattern (transportnetwork)

The formal definition of these patterns is available in OFN Syntax.

docs.title: Alert
docs.text:
An Alert can be used to notify people of important information.

Open interactive Alert diagram

docs.title: Specializations of Alert
docs.text: Class Description Transport Alert A TransportAlert is a type of alert that can be used to notify people of important transport information.

docs.title: ITSPattern
docs.text: Open interactive ITSPattern diagram

docs.title: Specializations of ITSPattern
docs.text:
Class Description Micromobility Network Pattern (transportnetwork) The micromobility network pattern specializes the road network pattern to address the needs for the travel of micromobility vehicles. Pedestrian Network Pattern (transportnetwork) The pedestrian network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for pedestrian travel. Public Transport System Pattern (transportnetwork) The public transport system pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for public transport travel. Whereas the transport network pattern focuses on infrastructure, the public transport system pattern focuses on the operations that rely on the infrastructure provided by the transport networks. Rail Network Pattern (transportnetwork) The rail network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for travel of rail vehicles (e.g., trains, subways, trams). Road Network Pattern (transportnetwork) The road network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for vehicular travel. Road networks that are primarily designed for the movement of micromobility vehicles should generally be defined using the micromobility network pattern, which is a specialization of this pattern. Transport Alert Pattern (transportnetwork) The transport alert pattern addresses the need for public agencies to alert groups to unusual transport-related conditions. Most of the features of the transport alert pattern can also be used for other types of alerts (e.g., meteorological events) and as such, its design includes the definition of a generalized alert. Transport Network Pattern (transportnetwork) The Transport Network Pattern models the core concepts involved in describing a transport network. This includes an identification of both physical and administrative characteristics. The most general class is that of the NetworkElement, which can be further classified as one of several types of NetworkElements.

A key feature of this pattern is the formalization of the hasProperPart relationship from a NetworkElement to another NetworkElement. This allows for a representation of networks at multiple levels of detail. For example, at one level, a motorway interchange can be modelled as a single Node. But that node is a NetworkElement that can be defined to consist of an entire TransportNetwork that has a node for each junction within the interchange. | | Travel Corridor Pattern (transportnetwork) | The travel corridor pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for a more holistic travel view. |

docs.title: Formalization for ITSPattern
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf ITSThing

docs.title: Micromobility Network Pattern
docs.text:
The micromobility network pattern specializes the road network pattern to address the needs for the travel of micromobility vehicles.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Micromobility Lane
  • Micromobility Link
  • Micromobility Network
  • Micromobility Path
  • Micromobility Path Section
  • Micromobility Path Segment

docs.title: MicromobilityPath
docs.text:
A MicromobilityPath is a type of Road that is made up of MicromobilityPathLinks.

Open interactive MicromobilityPath diagram

docs.title: Formalization for MicromobilityPath

docs.title: Other annotations

docs.title: MicromobilityPathSection
docs.text:
A MicromobilityPathSections is a type of RoadSection that groups MicromobilityLinks and MicromobilityPathSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating areas of shared use).

Open interactive MicromobilityPathSection diagram

docs.title: NetworkElement
docs.text:
A NetworkElement represents any element of a transport network. It can be a part of another NetworkElement and can be decomposed into smaller NetworkElements.

Open interactive NetworkElement diagram

docs.title: Specializations of NetworkElement
docs.text: Class Description Footpath A Footpath is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of FootpathLinks. Footpath Lane A FootpathLane is a type of TravelledWayLane that forms part of a FootpathSegment. Footpath Link A Footpath Link is a type of TravelledWayLink designed for pedestrians. Footpath Network A FootpathNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork designed for the use of pedestrians but may be used by others as well. Footpath Section A FootpathSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups FootpathLinks and FootpathSegments for a useful operational purpose. Footpath Segment A FootpathSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that represents a portion of a FootpathLink with common physical characteristics. Junction A Junction is a TransportNode that allows a traveller to connect from one TravelledWayLink to another. Micromobility Lane A MicromobilityLane is a type of RoadLane that forms part of a MicromobilityPathSegment. Micromobility Link A MicromobilityLink is a type of RoadLink designed for micromobility vehicles. Micromobility Network A MicromobilityNetwork is a type of RoadNetwork designed for the use of micromobility vehicles, which have more limited performance characteristics than motor vehicles. Micromobility Path A MicromobilityPath is a type of Road that is made up of MicromobilityPathLinks. Micromobility Path Section A MicromobilityPathSections is a type of RoadSection that groups MicromobilityLinks and MicromobilityPathSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating areas of shared use). Micromobility Path Segment A MicromobilityPathSegment is a type of RoadSegment that represents a portion of a MicromobilityLink with common physical characteristics. Rail Corridor A RailCorridor is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of TrackLinks. Rail Network A RailNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork using rails on a stabilized base. Rail Section A RailSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups TrackLinks and TrackSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating a traffic control scheme). Road A Road is a type of TravelledWay and transinfras:Road that is made up of RoadLinks. Roads form a proper part of RoadNetworks. Road Lane A RoadLane is a type of TravelledWayLane that forms part of a RoadSegment. Road Link A RoadLink is a type of TravelledWayLink and transinfras:RoadLink using a stabilized base designed for the movement of vehicles that conform to a specified set of requirements but may be used by others as well. Road Network A RoadNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork using a stabilized base designed for the movement of vehicles, other than rail or air vehicles, that conform to a specified set of requirements but may be used by others as well. Road Section A RoadSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups RoadLinks and RoadSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating a traffic control scheme). Road Segment A RoadSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment and transinfas:RoadSegment that represents a portion of a RoadLink with common physical characteristics. Route Point A RoutePoint represents a point of interest along a PublicTransportRoute. Track Link A TrackLink is a type of TravelledWayLink that uses rails on a stabilized base. Track Segment A TrackSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that represents a portion of a TrackLink with common physical characteristics. Transport Network A TransportNetwork is a NetworkElement that is a collection of other network elements that jointly represent a network of paths along which entities (e.g., vehicles, pedestrians) of a specified mode can operate. Transport Node A TransportNode is a NetworkElement that represents a node on the transport network that can be used to designate an end to a link or to join links. Travel Corridor A TravelCorridor is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of TravelCorridorLinks. Travel Corridor Link A TravelCorridorLink is a type of TravelledWayLink that is made up of TravelCorridorSegments. Travel Corridor Segment A TravelCorridorSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that logically groups multiple TravelledWaySegments together as being co-located or side-by-side. Travelled Way A TravelledWay is a type of NetworkElement and transinfras:TravelledWay that represents the curvilinear length of a transport route that is identified by a specific designator. Travelled Way Lane A TravelledWayLane is a NetworkElement that is a portion of TravelledWaySegment intended to accommodate a single line of moving material entities (e.g., vehicles) along its length. Travelled Way Link A TravelledWayLink is a type of NetworkElement and transinfras:TravelledWayLink. It represents a contiguous length of a TravelledWay between two TransportNodes of operational or managerial significance. Travelled Way Section A TravelledWaySection is a type of NetworkElement that represents an aggregation of TravelledWayLinks and TravelledWaySegments that jointly represent a contiguous length of a path that shares the same management and operational strategies (within the scope of interest of the implementation). Travelled Way Segment A TravelledWaySegment is a type of a transinfras:TravelledWaySegment and NetworkElement that represents a contiguous length of a TravelledWayLink characterized by the same physical characteristics.

docs.title: Pedestrian Network Pattern
docs.text:
The pedestrian network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for pedestrian travel.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Footpath
  • Footpath Lane
  • Footpath Link
  • Footpath Network
  • Footpath Section
  • Footpath Segment

docs.title: PointOnRoute
docs.text:
A PointOnRoute represents an ordered RoutePoint for a PublicTransportRoute.

Open interactive PointOnRoute diagram

docs.title: Formalization for PointOnRoute
docs.text: Property Constraint index all xsd::integer index exactly 1 owl::Thing point all RoutePoint point exactly 1 owl::Thing routePointType all code::Code subClassOf PublicTransportElement

docs.title: PublicTransportElement
docs.text: Open interactive PublicTransportElement diagram

docs.title: Specializations of PublicTransportElement
docs.text: Class Description Group Of Lines A GroupOfLines is a logical grouping of PublicTransportLines for any useful purpose. Point On Route A PointOnRoute represents an ordered RoutePoint for a PublicTransportRoute. Public Transport Line A PublicTransportLine is one or more routes used by public transport vehicles to transport passengers to and from designated locations. Public Transport Route A PublicTransportRoute represents one specific path used by a public transport vehicle to transport passengers to and from designated locations. Public Transport System A PublicTransportSystem provides transport services to members of the public. Route Point A RoutePoint represents a point of interest along a PublicTransportRoute.

docs.title: Formalization for PublicTransportElement
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf ITSThing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern PublicTransportSystemPattern

docs.title: PublicTransportRoute
docs.text:
A PublicTransportRoute represents one specific path used by a public transport vehicle to transport passengers to and from designated locations.

NOTE: For example, a PublicTransportLine might use an alternate PublicTransportRoute to reach its next stop during periods of congestion.

Open interactive PublicTransportRoute diagram

docs.text:
A PublicTransportSystem provides transport services to members of the public.

Open interactive PublicTransportSystem diagram

docs.title: Public Transport System Pattern
docs.text:
The public transport system pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for public transport travel. Whereas the transport network pattern focuses on infrastructure, the public transport system pattern focuses on the operations that rely on the infrastructure provided by the transport networks.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Group Of Lines
  • Point On Route
  • Public Transport Element
  • Public Transport Line
  • Public Transport Route
  • Public Transport System
  • Route Point

docs.title: Rail Network Pattern
docs.text:
The rail network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for travel of rail vehicles (e.g., trains, subways, trams).

It consists of the following classes:

  • Rail Corridor
  • Rail Network
  • Rail Section
  • Track Link
  • Track Segment

docs.text:
A RailSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups TrackLinks and TrackSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating a traffic control scheme).

docs.title: RoadLinkUserType
docs.text:
A RoadLinkUserType represents the unique combination of a RoadLink and a UserType such that speed limits and other characteristics can be defined to apply to specific user types when operating along a particular road link.

Open interactive RoadLinkUserType diagram

docs.title: RoadNetwork
docs.text:
A RoadNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork using a stabilized base designed for the movement of vehicles, other than rail or air vehicles, that conform to a specified set of requirements but may be used by others as well.

Open interactive RoadNetwork diagram

docs.text: Class Description Micromobility Network A MicromobilityNetwork is a type of RoadNetwork designed for the use of micromobility vehicles, which have more limited performance characteristics than motor vehicles.

docs.title: Road Network Pattern
docs.text:
The road network pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for vehicular travel. Road networks that are primarily designed for the movement of micromobility vehicles should generally be defined using the micromobility network pattern, which is a specialization of this pattern.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Road
  • Road Lane
  • Road Link
  • Road Link User Type
  • Road Network
  • Road Section
  • Road Segment

docs.title: RoadSection
docs.text:
A RoadSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups RoadLinks and RoadSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating a traffic control scheme).

Open interactive RoadSection diagram

docs.title: Specializations of RoadSection
docs.text: Class Description Micromobility Path Section A MicromobilityPathSections is a type of RoadSection that groups MicromobilityLinks and MicromobilityPathSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating areas of shared use).

docs.title: RoadSegment
docs.text:
A RoadSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment and transinfas:RoadSegment that represents a portion of a RoadLink with common physical characteristics.

Open interactive RoadSegment diagram

docs.title: Specializations of RoadSegment
docs.text: Class Description Micromobility Path Segment A MicromobilityPathSegment is a type of RoadSegment that represents a portion of a MicromobilityLink with common physical characteristics.

docs.title: RoutePoint
docs.text:
A RoutePoint represents a point of interest along a PublicTransportRoute.

Open interactive RoutePoint diagram

The operational status of an entity, e.g., open or closed.

docs.title: TrackLink
docs.text:
A TrackLink is a type of TravelledWayLink that uses rails on a stabilized base.

Open interactive TrackLink diagram

A TrackSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that represents a portion of a TrackLink with common physical characteristics.

Open interactive TrackSegment diagram

docs.title: TransportAlert
docs.text:
A TransportAlert is a type of alert that can be used to notify people of important transport information.

Open interactive TransportAlert diagram

docs.title: Formalization for TransportAlert
docs.text: Property Constraint affects all NetworkElement subClassOf Alert

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TransportAlertPattern

docs.title: Transport Alert Pattern
docs.text:
The transport alert pattern addresses the need for public agencies to alert groups to unusual transport-related conditions. Most of the features of the transport alert pattern can also be used for other types of alerts (e.g., meteorological events) and as such, its design includes the definition of a generalized alert.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Alert
  • Transport Alert

docs.title: TransportNetwork
docs.text:
A TransportNetwork is a NetworkElement that is a collection of other network elements that jointly represent a network of paths along which entities (e.g., vehicles, pedestrians) of a specified mode can operate.

Open interactive TransportNetwork diagram

docs.title: Specializations of TransportNetwork
docs.text: Class Description Footpath Network A FootpathNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork designed for the use of pedestrians but may be used by others as well. Micromobility Network A MicromobilityNetwork is a type of RoadNetwork designed for the use of micromobility vehicles, which have more limited performance characteristics than motor vehicles. Rail Network A RailNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork using rails on a stabilized base. Road Network A RoadNetwork is a type of TransportNetwork using a stabilized base designed for the movement of vehicles, other than rail or air vehicles, that conform to a specified set of requirements but may be used by others as well.

docs.title: Formalization for TransportNetwork
docs.text: Property Constraint partwhole::hasProperPart all TransportNetwork or TransportNode or TravelledWay or TravelledWayLink or TravelledWaySection partwhole::properPartOf all TransportNetwork subClassOf NetworkElement

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Transport Network partwhole::properPartOf Transport Node partwhole::properPartOf Travelled Way partwhole::properPartOf Travelled Way Section partwhole::properPartOf

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: Transport Network Pattern
docs.text:
The Transport Network Pattern models the core concepts involved in describing a transport network. This includes an identification of both physical and administrative characteristics. The most general class is that of the NetworkElement, which can be further classified as one of several types of NetworkElements.

A key feature of this pattern is the formalization of the hasProperPart relationship from a NetworkElement to another NetworkElement. This allows for a representation of networks at multiple levels of detail. For example, at one level, a motorway interchange can be modelled as a single Node. But that node is a NetworkElement that can be defined to consist of an entire TransportNetwork that has a node for each junction within the interchange.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Junction
  • Network Element
  • Scheduled Code
  • Transport Network
  • Transport Node
  • Travelled Way
  • Travelled Way Lane
  • Travelled Way Link
  • Travelled Way Section
  • Travelled Way Segment

docs.title: TransportNode
docs.text:
A TransportNode is a NetworkElement that represents a node on the transport network that can be used to designate an end to a link or to join links.

Open interactive TransportNode diagram

docs.title: Specializations of TransportNode
docs.text: Class Description Junction A Junction is a TransportNode that allows a traveller to connect from one TravelledWayLink to another. Route Point A RoutePoint represents a point of interest along a PublicTransportRoute.

docs.title: Formalization for TransportNode

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelCorridor
docs.text:
A TravelCorridor is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of TravelCorridorLinks.

NOTE: The extent of a TravelCorridor is defined by the extent of the path that shares the designator assigned to the TravelCorridor.

Open interactive TravelCorridor diagram

docs.title: Formalization for TravelCorridor
docs.text: Property Constraint partwhole::hasProperPart all TravelCorridorLink partwhole::hasProperPart min 1 owl::Thing subClassOf TravelledWay

docs.title: Used by classes

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TravelCorridorPattern

docs.title: TravelCorridorLink
docs.text:
A TravelCorridorLink is a type of TravelledWayLink that is made up of TravelCorridorSegments.

Open interactive TravelCorridorLink diagram

docs.title: Formalization for TravelCorridorLink
docs.text: Property Constraint partwhole::hasProperPart all TravelCorridorSegment partwhole::hasProperPart min 1 owl::Thing partwhole::properPartOf all TravelCorridor subClassOf TravelledWayLink

docs.title: Used by classes

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TravelCorridorPattern

docs.title: Travel Corridor Pattern
docs.text:
The travel corridor pattern specializes the transport network pattern to address the needs for a more holistic travel view.

It consists of the following classes:

  • Travel Corridor
  • Travel Corridor Link
  • Travel Corridor Segment

docs.title: TravelCorridorSegment
docs.text:
A TravelCorridorSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that logically groups multiple TravelledWaySegments together as being co-located or side-by-side.

Open interactive TravelCorridorSegment diagram

docs.title: Formalization for TravelCorridorSegment
docs.text: Property Constraint corridorElement all TravelledWaySegment corridorElement min 1 owl::Thing partwhole::properPartOf all TravelCorridorLink subClassOf TravelledWaySegment

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TravelCorridorPattern

docs.title: TravelledWay
docs.text:
A TravelledWay is a type of NetworkElement and transinfras:TravelledWay that represents the curvilinear length of a transport route that is identified by a specific designator.

Open interactive TravelledWay diagram

docs.title: Specializations of TravelledWay
docs.text: Class Description Footpath A Footpath is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of FootpathLinks. Micromobility Path A MicromobilityPath is a type of Road that is made up of MicromobilityPathLinks. Rail Corridor A RailCorridor is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of TrackLinks. Road A Road is a type of TravelledWay and transinfras:Road that is made up of RoadLinks. Roads form a proper part of RoadNetworks. Travel Corridor A TravelCorridor is a type of TravelledWay that is made up of TravelCorridorLinks.

docs.title: Formalization for TravelledWay
docs.text: Property Constraint designator all xsd::string designator exactly 1 owl::Thing partwhole::hasProperPart all TravelledWayLink partwhole::properPartOf all TransportNetwork partwhole::properPartOf min 1 owl::Thing subClassOf NetworkElement subClassOf transinfras::TravelledWay

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelledWayLane
docs.text:
A TravelledWayLane is a NetworkElement that is a portion of TravelledWaySegment intended to accommodate a single line of moving material entities (e.g., vehicles) along its length.

Open interactive TravelledWayLane diagram

docs.title: Specializations of TravelledWayLane
docs.text: Class Description Footpath Lane A FootpathLane is a type of TravelledWayLane that forms part of a FootpathSegment. Micromobility Lane A MicromobilityLane is a type of RoadLane that forms part of a MicromobilityPathSegment. Road Lane A RoadLane is a type of TravelledWayLane that forms part of a RoadSegment.

docs.title: Formalization for TravelledWayLane
docs.text: Property Constraint partwhole::properPartOf all TravelledWaySegment partwhole::properPartOf min 1 owl::Thing subClassOf NetworkElement

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Travelled Way Segment partwhole::hasProperPart

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelledWayLink
docs.text:
A TravelledWayLink is a type of NetworkElement and transinfras:TravelledWayLink. It represents a contiguous length of a TravelledWay between two TransportNodes of operational or managerial significance.

Open interactive TravelledWayLink diagram

docs.title: Specializations of TravelledWayLink
docs.text: Class Description Footpath Link A Footpath Link is a type of TravelledWayLink designed for pedestrians. Micromobility Link A MicromobilityLink is a type of RoadLink designed for micromobility vehicles. Road Link A RoadLink is a type of TravelledWayLink and transinfras:RoadLink using a stabilized base designed for the movement of vehicles that conform to a specified set of requirements but may be used by others as well. Track Link A TrackLink is a type of TravelledWayLink that uses rails on a stabilized base. Travel Corridor Link A TravelCorridorLink is a type of TravelledWayLink that is made up of TravelCorridorSegments.

docs.title: Formalization for TravelledWayLink
docs.text: Property Constraint allowedDirections all code::Code allowedDirections max 1 owl::Thing from all TransportNode from exactly 1 owl::Thing partwhole::hasProperPart all TravelledWaySegment partwhole::properPartOf all TransportNetwork or TravelledWay or TravelledWaySection partwhole::properPartOf min 1 owl::Thing subClassOf NetworkElement subClassOf transinfras::TravelledWayLink to all TransportNode to exactly 1 owl::Thing

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelledWaySection
docs.text:
A TravelledWaySection is a type of NetworkElement that represents an aggregation of TravelledWayLinks and TravelledWaySegments that jointly represent a contiguous length of a path that shares the same management and operational strategies (within the scope of interest of the implementation).

Open interactive TravelledWaySection diagram

docs.title: Specializations of TravelledWaySection
docs.text: Class Description Footpath Section A FootpathSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups FootpathLinks and FootpathSegments for a useful operational purpose. Micromobility Path Section A MicromobilityPathSections is a type of RoadSection that groups MicromobilityLinks and MicromobilityPathSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating areas of shared use). Rail Section A RailSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups TrackLinks and TrackSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating a traffic control scheme). Road Section A RoadSection is a type of TravelledWaySection that groups RoadLinks and RoadSegments for a useful operational purpose (e.g., assigning a speed limit, designating a traffic control scheme).

docs.title: Formalization for TravelledWaySection
docs.text: Property Constraint partwhole::hasProperPart all TravelledWayLink or TravelledWaySegment partwhole::properPartOf all TransportNetwork partwhole::properPartOf min 1 owl::Thing subClassOf NetworkElement

docs.title: Other annotations
docs.text: Annotation Value xsd::pattern TransportNetworkPattern

docs.title: TravelledWaySegment
docs.text:
A TravelledWaySegment is a type of a transinfras:TravelledWaySegment and NetworkElement that represents a contiguous length of a TravelledWayLink characterized by the same physical characteristics.

Open interactive TravelledWaySegment diagram

docs.title: Specializations of TravelledWaySegment
docs.text: Class Description Footpath Segment A FootpathSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that represents a portion of a FootpathLink with common physical characteristics. Micromobility Path Segment A MicromobilityPathSegment is a type of RoadSegment that represents a portion of a MicromobilityLink with common physical characteristics. Road Segment A RoadSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment and transinfas:RoadSegment that represents a portion of a RoadLink with common physical characteristics. Track Segment A TrackSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that represents a portion of a TrackLink with common physical characteristics. Travel Corridor Segment A TravelCorridorSegment is a type of TravelledWaySegment that logically groups multiple TravelledWaySegments together as being co-located or side-by-side.
